intro: Microlicia uncata, commonly known as the slender microlicia, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or greenish-white, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Microlicia uncata is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
